newsitem.title: USA: Sano sees smoking therapy Phase III in 97.
newsitem.headline: Sano sees smoking therapy Phase III in 97.

text.p: Sano Corp said Wednesday a Phase II dosing trial of its patented therapy to get people to stop smoking posted positive results, and it planned to start Phase III trials in the first quarter 1997.
The product, called Nicotine/Mecamylamine Transdermal System, has an adhesive patch through which nicotine and mecamylamine are simultaneously delivered through the patient's skin.
The therapy is meant to reduce the satisfaction that smokers experience from cigarettes and their craving.
Sano Corp develops transdermal delivery systems.
